description: Dave Smith talks about the Bluetooth Low Energy (or LE) APIs now available in the Android framework, and show you how easy it is to add some really interesting capabilities to mobile applications using this technology. Bluetooth LE was introduced to the core Android framework in 4.3, or API Level 18.
title: Developing Bluetooth Smart Applications for Android

description: If you’re working with async processes, transparent error handling is a must for adequate user experience. This example is about calling a REST service, where error handling is particularly important: as networking is sensitive, it always requires some sort of retry, timeout and failure mechanism. RxJava is built for creating fault-tolerant apps, this tutorial will show you the basics.
title: RxJava and Android: error handling
